condition.narrative: Section IB.B.3 of Schedule 2 to the LA: “if any of the DLRs under Category 1), (2), (3),(4),(5),(6) or (7) has not been achieved,the Bank may, by notice to the Borrower: (a) reallocate all or a portion of the proceeds of the Loan then allocated to said DLR toany other DLR ; and/or (b) cancel all or a portion of the proceeds of the Loan then allocated to said DLR.”

• Section I.A.1(b) of Schedule 2:no later than fifteen (15) days after the Effective Date, or such later date as agreed by theBank, designate and thereafter maintain, the Operational Teams, staffed with adequate professional, fiduciary, technical personnelof the relevant Borrower's entities/agencies with technical responsibility in the day-to-day implementation of the Programactivities, including the DHU, the INM, the MARHP, the ONPC, the CGA, the ME and the MOF, all as further defined described in theProgram Operational Manual

• Section I.A.1(c) of Schedule 2:no later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, or such later date as agreed by theBank, establish and thereafter maintain, throughout Program implementation, an inter-ministerial steering committee (“ComitEinterministEriel de pilotage stratEgique” or “CIPS”), with functions, staffing and resources satisfactory to the Bank, to beresponsible for providing strategic oversight and guidance under the Program, including overseeing Program implementation, allunder terms and conditions acceptable to the Bank and described in the Project Operational Manual.

• Section I.A.2(a) of Schedule 2:no later than five (5) days after the Effective Date, or any later date as agreed by the Bank,prepare a manual acceptable to the Bank (“Program Operational Manual” or “POM”), and immediately thereafter, ensure that theProgram is implemented in accordance with the POM

title.narrative: An improved understanding of catastrophic risk and a developed actuarial model allowing the increase of the coverage of Nat Cat insurance.

baseline.value: No catastrophic risk data base and no actuarial model.

target.value: Dissemination of the insights coming from the finalized actuarial model and from the financial exposure database updates to theinsurance sector.

actual.value: No catastrophic risk data base and no actuarial model.

title.narrative: Organizational and institutional reform of the climate and hydrometeorological service providers in place.

baseline.value: - Laws establishing the INM and the MARHP but no regulatory text exists to establish the hydromet value chain- INM organizationalchart proposal, but not yet approved- No data sharing protocol except the agreement for Medjerda. Recently signed INM-MinAgrigeneral agreement

target.value: Regulations for data exchange adopted the Ministries concerned.

actual.value: - Laws establishing the INM and the MARHP but no regulatory text exists to establish the hydromet value chain- INM organizationalchart proposal, but not yet approved- No data sharing protocol except the agreement for Medjerda. Recently signed INM-MinAgrigeneral agreement

title.narrative: Urban flood risk reduction projects are implemented and completed.

target.value: (i)Cumulative value of works implemented to date of flood risk reduction investment projects is TDM 112(ii) Cumulative number ofcompleted flood risk reduction projects is 6.

title.narrative: Number of eligible beneficiaries of a public financing mechanism in line with the priorities and objectives set in the National DRFstrategy, with a monitoring of the share of women beneficiaries.
Number of people reached by Multi-Hazards Impact-Based Forecasts and Early Warning Services - disaggregated by sex.
Number of people covered by urban flood risk reduction infrastructure supported by the Program - disaggregated by sex
A sovereign disaster risk financing (DRF) Strategy is implemented.

baseline.value: Absence of a National DRF strategy.

target.value: Operationalization of the public financing mechanism and of the national compensation (claims) registry that collects disaggregateddata on women's and men's coverage in case of disasters.

actual.value: Absence of a National DRF strategy.

title.narrative: Institutional coordination mechanisms and the regulatory framework for climate and disaster risk management are strengthened.

baseline.value: Absence of an updated and integrated legal framework covering all DRM components. Existence of a 1991 Law focusing on emergencypreparedness and response and establishing the National Commission and Regional Commissions for the Fight Against Calamities.Existence of a 2018 Local Government code transferring DRM-related responsibilities to municipalities.

target.value: An action plan to continue the regulatory and institutional reforminitiated through the Program, outlining the new institutionalframework and roles and responsibilities and policy priorities to strengthen sustainable climate resilience and disaster riskmanagement in Tunisia has been approved by the Borrower.

actual.value: Absence of an updated and integrated legal framework covering all DRM components. Existence of a 1991 Law focusing on emergencypreparedness and response and establishing the National Commission and Regional Commissions for the Fight Against Calamities.Existence of a 2018 Local Government code transferring DRM-related responsibilities to municipalities.

title.narrative: Production and implementation of MH-IBF-EWS, with emphasis on climate-related events (e.g floods).

baseline.value: - The first version of the 'Carte de Vigilance’ exists- National weather forecasts exist, but need to be brought down to regionaland local levels- Hydrological modeling only for Medjerda.

target.value: The improved ‘Carte de Vigilance’ including Vigicrue and the impact-based forecasts and risk-based warnings are rolled outnationally.

actual.value: - The first version of the 'Carte de Vigilance’ exists- National weather forecasts exist, but need to be brought down to regionaland local levels- Hydrological modeling only for Medjerda.

title.narrative: The early warning systems in the country are strengthened.

baseline.value: Absence of a national and regional levels early warning systems.

target.value: Establishment of early response plans at the national, regional and local level in pilot areas, EWS communication strategy.

actual.value: Absence of a national and regional levels early warning systems.

title.narrative: Enhanced business opportunities by developing products targeting selected sectors.

baseline.value: No products and services dedicated to sectors (except meteorological products and services for aviation).

target.value: Commercial products developed for the Agriculture sector tested and adopted.

actual.value: No products and services dedicated to sectors (except meteorological products and services for aviation).29-Jan-2021
